rep_utterance: From an access/formulary angle, are there specific steps we should navigate for later-line ADCs at your centre?
hcp_reply: For later-line antibody-drug conjugates, we follow standard hospital formulary and MDT protocols, ensuring use aligns with the approved SmPC. Access typically requires documentation of prior therapies and on-label eligibility. If you have a concise checklist or summary of local requirements, please share it, and I can review with our pharmacy and MDT leads. For any access barriers, a brief follow-up can be arranged.

rep_utterance: Any prior-authorisation or therapeutic committee requirements where a concise EU-label summary would help? European Medicines Agency (EMA)
hcp_reply: For later-line antibody-drug conjugates, our centre typically requires prior authorisation and review by the therapeutic committee, especially for newer agents. A concise EU-label summary is helpful to streamline this process and ensure alignment with approved indications. Please send a one-page summary referencing the EMA label, and I can confirm if any additional documentation is needed for our formulary pathway.

rep_utterance: If your institution needs a nurse in-service or order-set endorsement, I can coordinate with your leads.
hcp_reply: A concise EU-label summary is helpful for our therapeutic committee review and order-set updates, especially for later-line ADCs. Prior authorisation is typically required, and clear documentation of on-label criteria streamlines approval. If a nurse in-service is needed, please send a brief outline and I can connect you with our nursing lead for scheduling. Let’s align on a one-page checklist and arrange a short follow-up.

rep_utterance: Happy to provide a one-page dossier (SmPC excerpts + local workflow mapping) for your internal review. European Medicines Agency (EMA)
hcp_reply: A concise SmPC-based summary and local workflow mapping would be helpful for our internal review and any required order-set updates. For later-line ADCs, we typically need prior authorisation and therapeutic committee approval, so clear EU-label alignment is important. Please send the one-page dossier, and I can coordinate with our pharmacy and nursing leads for any in-service or endorsement needs. Let’s arrange a brief follow-up once the materials are received.
